They defend these territories ferociously, patrolling them vigilantly. They are nocturnal predators, behaving similarly to will-o-wisps. They will lure unsuspecting travelers and other creatures close enough to be shocked and devoured. In fact, in areas where will-o’-wisps are present, the rogue males will often mistake their lights for a challenging male, charging towards the tiny undead with immense prejudice.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The whale's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 19}), requiring no material components:
will: {@spell create or destroy water} (90 gallons; rains approximately 5,335,923,600 gallons)

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the whale hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

trait.name: Flooded
entries: Any space that has been flooded by one of the whale's actions is filled with two to three feet of water, and it is difficult terrain for any creature without an innate or magical swimming speed. The flooded areas remain flooded for 24 hours, until the whale absorbs the water, or until it is turned to steam.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the whale fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Cackling
entries: The skeleton of Captain Ahab cackles madly, disorienting each creature that can hear him and isn’t {@condition incapacitated}. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the whale and can hear the cackling must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and begins to hallucinate, becoming afflicted with a short-term madness effect (determined randomly or by the DM). The effect lasts 10 minutes and the target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 24 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the whale's turns. If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, or 44 ({@damage 8d6 + 16}) bludgeoning damage if the target is an object.

action.name: Tidal Wave
entries: The whale conjures up a wave of water that crashes down on an area in front of it. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

action.name: Maelstrom
entries: The water in a 30-foot radius around the whale is pulled towards it and absorbed into its body, increasing its AC by 2 until the end of its next turn. Each creature in flooded terrain must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the whale on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and is not pulled.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The whale uses a tail attack.

legendary.name: Charge (Uses 2 Actions)
entries: The whale moves up to its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creature or object caught in its path must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save and being pushed 10 feet away from the whale. On a successful save, the target is not affected by this attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The whale makes a perception check.

In most sea-faring cultures, tales about epic battles between brave sailors and massive leviathans are incorporated so deeply within their society that, as time goes on, some believe the legends of heroism and adventure to be accurate recounts of the sea, and thus embark on epic quests to search for and slay dangerous nautical fiends. In most cases, these stories truly are just myth, but in one of the most famous tales of all, the beast recounted was a true demon. Moby Dick, the White Whale, is an ancient predator that stalks the seas in search of whaling ships to destroy so that it may devour the blood of man to feed its insatiable appetite for flesh. Resembling a massive sperm whale with an enormous, toothed maw, the White Whale commands the sea to its whim, and is capable of conjuring colossal waves at will. Occasionally, it will create massive tsunamis in order to sweep inland, carrying warm flesh out to sea where it can be easily devoured. Several harpoons are embedded within its thick hide, and a skeleton ensnared to its back cackles madly.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The stag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the golden stag moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

{@italic As Helvetica lie, helpless and dying, her companions could do nothing more than comfort her in her final moments. As her breathing became shallow, her friends knew she was nearing her last. Before she had the chance to take in her final breath, an elk cloaked in a golden sheen stepped out of the thick fog, approaching the group like a noble ruler. Wordlessly, the party allowed the animal to approach Helvetica, where it gently enveloped her with its crown of golden antlers. A dim, radiant light poured from the beast’s royal circlet of bone, and within moments, Helvetica stretched her limbs casually as if awoken from a deep slumber.}

Golden stags are magical cousins to elk and other cervids. It is an avid protector of the animals in its forest, often coming to their rescue. A golden stag is also sympathetic to those who get lost in its woods or seem to struggle with survival in the cold. The creature beckons unfortunate travelers to follow it to safety, often just outside a village it knows to be friendly. If a visitor to a forest overseen by a golden stag has a peaceful encounter with the creature, the stag might later come to that visitor's aid, protecting it from predatory animals or rescuing it from some natural hazard. Additionally, the golden stag commands some innate healing ability, using it to heal the sick, wounded, or dying. Many desperate travelers bring loved ones to forests inhabited by golden stags in hope of receiving help from the forest guardian.

trait.name: Bad Flier
entries: The storm chicken falls at the end of its turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

trait.name: Call of the Storm
entries: The storm chicken can cast {@spell control weather} at will, requiring no material components and requiring only one action to cast, in which the storm chicken crows into the ether above, pleading for the dark gods to answer its malevolent cry.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d1 + 2}) piercing damage.

{@italic Villagers scramble about a lively town square, busily going about their daily lives. They were grateful for such a beautiful day, as the past week had been dreary and gray. Disgusted by the joy of it all, an average-looking rooster perches upon a fencepost, observing the people as they enjoyed the simplicity of life. The bird crowed loudly, emitting a hoarse, cackling call. The townsfolk, too preoccupied with their own existences, paid the chicken no mind. Laughing to itself, the malevolent little rooster knew that in just a few minutes, the clear blue sky would be crowded with puffy gray clouds, threatening to fill the surrounding area with a light drizzle. This day would be regarded as a minor annoyance by many.}

Alright, first of all, screw the formalities. I made this thing late at night because I was bored and wanted to make a powerful little chicken monster. So basically, I made this malevolent little bastard. He looks like a regular rooster, but he actually is a malicious little monstrosity thing that can control the very weather with his crow, which is hoarse as {@italic fuck}. So he goes around and makes beautiful days shitty so that he can dance atop the sorrows of people. Busy day? Rain. Wedding? Rain. Party? Rain. This deep fried little shit is the lord of minor inconveniences. Also, he can control the literal fucking weather, so don’t piss him off. He will tornado your house.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ursa polaris' innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ursa polaris has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The ursa polaris can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The ursa polaris has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Rime
entries: An area covered in rime is difficult terrain. Additionally, any creature that ends its turn while touching a frost covered area takes 4 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage and is {@condition grappled} by the frost (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes three attacks; one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Icewind Gale {@recharge 5}
entries: The ursa polaris exhales an icy blast of freezing wind in a 60-foot cone. The area is covered in rime for 1 minute and each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage on a failed save. Additionally, the creature magically begins to freeze and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. It can't be thawed and is immune to all damage and conditions until freed. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition petrified}.

{@italic Thick, white fur coats this hulking ursine, and massive crystalline shards of ice protrude from its shoulders. When it lets out a mighty roar, frigid breath dances between the jagged sprouts of ice that form its teeth.}

A fearsome sight, the ursa polaris dwarfs even the largest of polar bears. Some believe that they are polar bears blessed or cursed by gods of cold, winter, and the north. Followers of such gods often leave a caribou carcass, whale blubber, or seal meat as an offering to the ursa polaris.

{@bold Creatures of Ice.}The ursa polaris thrives in freezing arctic conditions and is capable of surviving off of ice alone, should other food sources become scarce. They dislike warmth; an ursa polaris will avoid warm waters and curl into its ice cavern when summer comes.

{@bold Fiercely Territorial. }The ursa polaris is a solitary creature, carving a vast swath of territory for itself and going out of its way to kill trespassers. Somewhere within its territory, a female ursa polaris will carve out an ice cavern to rear young; this cavern may be within glacial ice, an iceberg, or simply a frosty stone cavern.
{@bold Icy Breath. }The ursa polaris can exhale a fragment of frigid arctic winds, disabling prey and cocooning them in rime for an easy kill.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elder balloon spider's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Adjust Density
entries: As a bonus action, the elder balloon spider can magically alter the weight of one object or creature that it can see within 30 feet of it if the object or creature is Huge or smaller, including itself. The target's weight is halved or doubled for up to 1 minute. While the weight of a creature is halved by this effect, the creature's speed increases by 20 feet, it can jump three times as far as normal, and it has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

While the weight of a creature is doubled by this effect, the creature's speed is reduced by 20 feet, its jump distance is halved, its attacks deal an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage, and it has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

The elder balloon spider can have only one target's weight altered at a time. If the elder balloon spiders alters the density of another creature while already altering another, the first effect immediately ends.

trait.name: Erratic Discharge
entries: A creature or object that starts its turn within 10 feet of the elder balloon spider must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 2 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage. On a success, the creature takes no damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The elder balloon spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder balloon spider uses its reel in. It then makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Charged Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) by strands of charged webbing and begins to hover 10 feet off the ground. Until this grapple ends, the target takes 6 lightning damage at the start of each of its turns and is retrained. In addition, the {@condition grappled} target can make a {@dc 16} Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to manipulate the strands of webbing and fly 10 feet in any direction.

action.name: Reel In
entries: The elder balloon spider reels in all creatures {@condition grappled} by its webbing up to 15 feet toward it. If this movement pulls the creature within 5 feet of the balloon spider, the spider can make one bite attack against the creature as a free action.

action.name: Event Horizon {@recharge}
entries: The elder balloon spider expels a burst of powerful localized gravity in a 30 foot radius, originating from the balloon spider. Falling damage in the area increases to {@dice 1d10} per 10 feet fallen. When a creature starts its turn within the area or enters it for the first time in a turn, including when the spider creates the field, it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure the creature is {@condition restrained}. On a success the creature's speed is halved as long as it remains in the field. A {@condition restrained} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn. The elder balloon spider is immune to the effects of its event horizon. The field persists until the spider's event horizon recharges again.

reaction.name: Gravitic Manipulation
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of the elder balloon spider, including itself, hits or is hit with a weapon attack, the balloon spider can use its reaction to increase or decrease the attack's velocity, causing the attack's target to take an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage or reduce the damage dealt by 5 ({@dice 2d4}).
Alternatively, if a creature within 60 feet of the spider takes damage from a fall, including itself, the spider can use its reaction to increase or reduce the fall's damage by 16 ({@dice 3d10}).

Balloon spiders are often captured or killed by those looking to collect their prized webbing, but those who manage to survive until maturity undergo a molting process that makes their chitinous flesh thicker and more conductive, allowing them to more effectively manipulate the electromagnetic fields that surround them. These elder balloon spiders grow to the size of horses and are capable of controlling electromagnetic forces and even gravity itself. Their nests often defy the natural forces of gravity and are considered cursed by some.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kirin's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kirin is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The kirin has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Command Lightning
entries: At the end of each of its turns, the kirin can choose three locations to be affected by the {@spell call lightning} spell. The lightning strikes at the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the kirin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The kirin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The kirin's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kirin makes two attacks; one with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The kirin makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Smite
entries: The kirin makes an attack with its hooves or casts thunderclap.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The kirin moves up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

{@italic The mythic Kirin resembles a unicorn, though closer inspection reveals that it is covered in rigid scales rather than a coat. Its majestic white mane and hair stand on end, as if charged with static. The equine beast often crackles with stray electricity.}

Kirin have radiant white fur used for collecting and effectively harnessing electricity. When a sufficient number of electrical currents have been accumulated, the Kirin will glow brightly, discharging vast amounts of electricity from its conductive hide, which will deflect almost all attacks. A Kirin's most vital feature, though, is its long, jagged horn. This horn is used to summon lightning from the sky, even when there isn't a storm cloud in sight. However, even if this horn is destroyed, Kirin are still capable of summoning lightning bolts with little effort.

Some of the more elusive, ancient, or plainly more potent individuals are known for having unusually strong electrical powers that are yet to be fully understood. Some of the larger, more powerful muscles are located in its legs, capable of delivering deadly kicks. Equipped with such powerful legs, all Kirin possess the ability to run at speeds so unexpectedly fast they appear to teleport, leaving behind a trail of blue, crackling electricity.

Kirin are as highly unpredictable as the lightning they harness. At times Kirin are tranquil, peaceful creatures, willing to share their chosen territory with large predators, while at others they are highly aggressive and territorial, trampling even mice if they so much as disturb the animal. In a distant legend, it was said that a Kirin destroyed an entire village simply because it made far too much noise for the irritable beast.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tortoise can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Massive Frame
entries: The tortoise can carry up to 20,000 pounds of weight atop its shell, but moves at half speed if the weight exceeds 10,000 pounds. Medium or smaller creatures can move underneath the tortoise while it's not {@condition prone}.
Any creature under the tortoise when it falls {@condition prone} is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shell Defense {@recharge 4}
entries: The tortoise withdraws into its shell, falls {@condition prone}, and gains a +5 bonus to AC. While the tortoise is in its shell, its speed is 0 and can't increase. The tortoise can emerge from its shell as an action, whereupon it is no longer {@condition prone}.

Desolate badlands and soggy marshes are home to the ancient and massive horizonback tortoises. Nearly fifty feet from nose to tail, and with a habit of remaining stationary for long periods, a horizonback tortoise is easy to mistake for a low hill at a distance. But when these impressive creatures rise to begin their march, the sight inspires fear and awe in equal parts. An omnivore of incredible size, these scavengers prefer to feed on dead vegetation, but make use of whatever edible matter they come across.

monster.name: The Sharptooth

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sharptooth's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Dread Reaper
entries: The Sharptooth scores a critical hit on any creature that is {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Sharptooth's long jump is up to 50 ft. and its high jump is up to 30 ft., with or without a running start.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Sharptooth deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Sharptooth moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Sharptooth can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Sharptooth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Apex Predator
entries: The Sharptooth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mega Predator
entries: The Sharptooth's attack rolls have advantage if its target is Large or smaller.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The Sharptooth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sharptooth makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its stomp or tail. It can use a swallow in place of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 5d12 + 10}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and The Sharptooth can't bite another target or use its prehistoric scream.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The Sharptooth makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Gishath, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of The Sharptooth's turns.

If The Sharptooth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of it. If The Sharptooth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d4 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or be thrown up to 15 ft. away from The Sharptooth and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Prehistoric Scream (Recharge 5-6
entries: The Sharptooth emits a petrifying roar in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area that can hear the Sharptooth must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is {@condition frightened} and {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute as the terror of extinction lays waste to its mind. On a success, a creature suffers no ill effects. An {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending both effects on itself on a success.

legendaryHeader: The Sharptooth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Sharptooth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Sharptooth makes one stomp or tail attack.

legendary.name: Rush
entries: The Sharptooth moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Spin (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Sharptooth spins in a wide circle, swinging its tail at any creatures within range. The Sharptooth makes a tail attack against each creature within 20 feet of it.

A manifestation of predatory malice in the form of nature's ultimate tyrant king, the Sharptooth dwarfs the largest of the behemoths, stomping, slashing, and tearing its way through the prehistoric jungles of Chult. It feeds on fear, preferring to fill its prey with the blind panic of complete extinctual annihilation whenever it roars, sending them into a thoughtless scramble and reducing them to nothing more than simple, mindless prey.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} until cured. While {@condition poisoned} this way, the target begins to degrade over the course of several hours until death or until the poison is cleansed. Every hour, the target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and has its hit point maximum reduced by that amount. Additionally, the target gains a level of {@condition exhaustion} every hour. After two hours, the target is {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

The King Cobra is an extremely dangerous terrestrial serpent, primarily preying on small mammals, birds, reptiles, and even other cobras. The cobra is widely regarded as one of the most deadly and iconic snakes, recognized by its prominent hood. Unlike most snakes, the cobra is extremely aggressive, and is responsible for the deaths of thousands every year.

While most know the stories of cobras killing elephants by sinking their long fangs into the soft tips of the elephant's trunk, not many know of the tale of a mere cobra that defended its nest from a tyrannical dragon who accidentally stumbled upon the little creature's brood. Sinking its fangs into the soft portions of flesh underneath the dragon's deep red scales, the cobra injected its deadly venom, barely even phasing the dragon. Immediately struck by a wave of agony, the dragon struggled to fly to its mountainous lair to rest. Too proud and stubborn to seek assistance from creatures lower than itself, the dragon laid there, curled in a ball of blood and necrotic flesh before finally passing away.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Maw of the Great Hyena's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena makes two bite attacks. If both attacks hit the target and the target is a creature, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition frightened} it takes an additional 22 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. This attack ignores damage resistance.

action.name: Call the Clan (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena magically duplicates itself, creating up to five spiritual replicas at a point it can see within 60 feet of itself. Each replica uses the statistics of the Maw of the Great Hyena except it does not have access to the Call the Clan trait. The Maw of the Great Hyena can communicate telepathically with a replica as long as they are within 120 feet of each other. The replicas act as allies of the Great Hyena and obey its telepathic commands. The replicas remain until killed or dismissed by the Great Hyena as a bonus action. Slain or dismissed replicas vaporize into warming orange wisps of flame.

action.name: Cackling Cacophony {@recharge 5}
entries: The Maw of the Great Hyena emits a maddening cackle of blazing air in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, each creature in that area that isn't {@condition deafened} must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the Great Hyena until the end of the hyena's next turn. While a creature is {@condition frightened} in this way, its speed is halved, and it is {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells:

trait.name: Jet
entries: While underwater, the kraken can take the dash action to jet backward at a speed of 140 feet. It must move in a straight line while using this ability.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The kraken can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kraken makes eight tentacle attacks and one mandibles attack. It can substitute two tentacles attacks for one constrict attack if it has a creature {@condition grappled} at the start of its turn, but it never constricts more than once per turn.

action.name: Mangling Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) slashing damage. This attack scores a critical hit on a target that is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 35 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 1d6 + 9}) piercing damage. If two tentacle attacks hit the same target in one turn, the target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}).

action.name: Constrict
entries: The constricted creature takes 29 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}) and {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Storm Cloud {@recharge 5}
entries: The kraken emits dark, rolling clouds that flash with lightning in a 30-foot cloud as a bonus action. The cloud affects vision as the darkness spell, and any creature that starts its turn inside the cloud takes 11 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. The kraken's {@sense darkvision} is not impaired by this cloud. The cloud persists for 1 minute, then disperses.

action.name: Vomit Forth the Deeps (1/Day)
entries: The kraken sprays electrified bile from its maw over a 30-foot cone. This shocking slurry causes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage and targets must make a successful {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Lightning Strike {@recharge}
entries: The kraken conjures a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: The kraken makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Hammer Arm (Uses 2 Actions)
entries: The kraken slams one of its bludgeoning arms down at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@dice 8d6}) bludgeoning and lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The kraken moves up to half its speed.

As our vessel crashed through yet another destructive wave, a number of the men started screaming and pointing at something in the sky. Looking up at it, I- Gods alive… Long, dark tentacles dangled from the sky as something descended from the rolling storm above. Lightning flashed, and the silhouette of a squid-like monster was illuminated by the flaring light. Its tendrils coiled around various members of the crew as an electric roar echoed louder than thunder. Hemmins, Jackson, Cathaway… it ate them. It ate them all.

Louder than thunder and more potent than lightning, the Kraken is a monstrous colossal squid that developed a destructive bond with the Elemental Plane of Air, harnessing the soul of the storm to wreak havoc on unsuspecting ships. Like its rival and nemesis, the White Whale, the Kraken exclusively preys on the flesh of humanoids, preferring the taste of sentient flesh and blood to anything else. On clear, sunny days, the Kraken drifts underneath the waves, submerged, scanning the horizon for evidence of humanoid presence. When lighting crackles through the air and the clouds are thick and dark, the Kraken rises up, hiding in the clouds and pulling sailors, pirates, and even entire ships into the sky to be crushed and devoured.

trait.name: Cryptobiosis
entries: When exposed to an environment or effect that is lethal to the tardigrade over time, such as an environment that lacks breathable water, being frozen solid, or taking poison damage over time, the tardigrade enters a state of suspended animation. While in this state, the tardigrade is {@condition unconscious} but immune to any environmental effects, as well as poison and necrotic damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. Any such ongoing effect is suspended but not removed. The cryptobiotic state ends as soon as conditions become tolerable for the tardigrade. The tardigrade can remain in this state for up to 30 years. If it remains in this state longer, it dies.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tardigrade can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 ‒1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the ubiytsov can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rabid Courage
entries: The ubiystov has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Corpse Eater
entries: When the ubiytsov hits an undead creature with a bite attack, it regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Tightening Bite
entries: Any creature that begins its turn {@condition grappled} by the ubiytsov takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ubiytsov has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ubiytsov makes one bite attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 6 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage if the target is undead. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} ({@dc 14}) as the ubiystov clings to its throat. While {@condition grappled}, the target can't breathe and begins suffocating at the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Hatred for Undeath
entries: If the ubiytsov is hit by an undead creature, it can immediately make a claw attack against the attacker.

Commonly referred to as Church Grims, ubiystovs are large wolverines that commonly inhabit graveyards due to their habit of scavenging on the dead. Ravenous and ferocious, ubiystovs in the wild are known to bring down creatures significantly larger than them, such as large bears, hill giants, mammoths, giant elk, and even Remorhaz. There is even a confirmed report of a particularly violent individual bringing down a white dragon, though this is considered a unique and extremely unlikely outcome. To sate their gluttonous nature, however, ubiystovs often lair in humanoid cemeteries, digging up corpses in the dead of night to eat bones and all. These animals would be considered dangerous pests if it weren’t for their particular and violent hatred for the undead. When the rotting walk once again, a ubiystov will fly into a terrific, bloodthirsty rage until the corpse has been shredded and devoured. Many undeath-opposers utilize ubiystovs to counter undead threats for this reason.

Surprisingly, the closest-living relative to the ubiystov isn’t the wolverine, but the savager. Larger, stronger, and bulkier, savagers are clearly the dominant animal when the two encounter one another, though savagers are known to actively avoid ubiystovs for their significantly more rabid disposition.

trait.name: Stable
entries: Whenever an effect knocks the bombarder beetle {@condition prone}, it can make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} beetle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

trait.name: Thermal
entries: The bombarder beetle can sense the heat radiating off of a creature. It can't be surprised by something that gives off heat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bombarder beetle fires two explosive rods.

action.name: Pike Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Explosive Rod
entries: The bombarder beetle chooses a point within 300 feet of it. Each target within 30 feet of that location must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. Any creature caught in the blast must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be thrown 10 feet away from the blast and knocked {@condition prone}. This attack deals double damage to structures and objects.

action.name: Barrage (Recharge One Hour)
entries: The bombarder beetle launches an intense barrage at a line within 600 feet of it. The line is 120 feet long and 15 feet wide. Each creature within 30 feet of the line must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take ({@damage 7d12}) fire damage and ({@damage 7d12}) thunder damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Any creature caught in the blast must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be thrown 20 feet away from the blast and knocked {@condition prone}. This attack deals double damage to structures and objects. After using this attack, the bombarder beetle can't use its explosive rod attack until its barrage recharges.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreadnoughtus makes one stomp attack and one tail attack.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 5d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}48 ({@damage 6d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 30 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

This colossal sauropod remains the largest beast to roam the planet, flattening landscapes under its thunderous footsteps. Its long, muscular tail can be used to pulverize even the most durable creatures with tremendous force.

trait.name: Controller
entries: The cheetah can use a bonus action to make a bite attack against a {@condition prone} or {@condition incapacitated} target within its reach.

trait.name: Blinding Speed (2/Short Rest)
entries: When the cheetah takes the Dash action it can move at 10 times its speed (600 ft.) during this movement. Additionally, if the cheetah succeeds on a {@dc 10} Constitution check at the end of its turn, its ability to use Blinding Speed recharges.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The cheetah has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Feline Agility
entries: The cheetah takes the Dash action.

The cheetah is a relatively medium, light cat that resides in savannas and rolling hills. It is the fastest land animal and can reach speeds of nearly 110 miles per hour in short bursts. Cheetahs hunt during the day, chasing prey at high speeds before tackling them and dealing the finishing blow.

monster.name: Gitrog
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Gitrog can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Hypnotic Secretion
entries: A creature that touches the Gitrog must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn or become {@condition poisoned} for the next 12 hours. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature also suffers disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. The {@condition poisoned} creature or a creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom (Medicine) check to end the effect.

trait.name: Hypnotic Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 120 feet of the Gitrog and is able to see the Gitrog's eyes, the Gitrog can magically force it to succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the toad until the Gitrog dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the Gitrog until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the Gitrog in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

A {@condition charmed} creature is under the Gitrog's control. The Gitrog and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage or when it starts its turn at least 1 mile away from the Gitrog, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. The save can be made no more than once every 24 hours. A target that successfully saves is immune to the Gitrog's Hypnotic Gaze for the next hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gitrog uses its Dominating Croak. It then makes one bite attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the Gitrog. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Gitrog, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the Gitrog's turns.

If the Gitrog takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Gitrog must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the Gitrog. If the Gitrog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dominating Croak
entries: A creature within 120 feet of the Gitrog that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and immediately turn to look at the Gitrog. Alternatively, the Gitrog can choose any number of creatures within 20 feet of it that can hear it. Each creature must make suceed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, immediately turning to look at the Gitrog on a failure.

reaction.name: Reconstitute
entries: If the Gitrog is suffering from one or more effects that require it to make a saving throw to end, it may immediately make a save against each effect. A successful save for any of the throws will end the effect immediately. The only saving throws that this reaction can be used for are saves that are made at the end/start of the Gitrog's next turn or using its action. It can use this reaction while {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature the Gitrog can see targets it with an attack, the Gitrog can choose another creature {@condition charmed} by it within 5 feet of it. The two swap places, and the chosen creature becomes the target instead.

trait.name: Bladed Tendrils
entries: The khanivore has four large tendrils extending from the back of its head which, on each of its turns as a bonus action, the khanivore can interlock to form one large tendril. It can separate them back into four tendrils again as a bonus action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the khanivore is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the khanivore instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Tendril Climb (Separated Tendrils Only)
entries: The khanivore can use its tendrils to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. While the khanivore climbs this way, its arms and legs remain free, and at any point during this movement, it can choose to suspend itself any distance up to 10 feet away from the surface it is climbing.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The khanivore's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The khanivore has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The khanivore makes three attacks: One with its bite and two with its claws. If the khanivore's tendrils are interlocked, it can make an attack with its monotendril or its fling. If the khanivore's tendrils are separated and it is not climbing, it can instead make four tendril attacks.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or lose 5 ({@damage 1d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an bloody wound. Each time the khanivore hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 ({@damage 1d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Monotendril (Interlocked Tendrils Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) piercing damage. This attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.

On a critical hit, the target is impaled. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends, at which point the creature is forced to make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. A creature loses 13 ({@damage 2d12}) hit points due to blood loss on a failed save, or half as many hit points on a successful one as long as the creature has blood (or some other analogous fluid) to lose. The khanivore can't attack with its tendrils or separate them while it has a target impaled.

action.name: Fling (Interlocked Tendrils Only)
entries: With a flick of its tendril, the khanivore flings a Large or smaller target it has impaled, ending the effect. The khanivore makes a Strength (Athletics) check, and the target is flung in a straight line a distance in feet equal to 2 multiplied by the result of the khanivore's check (rounded up). The flung target travels the distance it was flung, or until it collides with a solid object or surface, taking 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet of the fling distance.

If the flung target would collide with a creature, the creature in its path can make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw to avoid being struck. On a failed save, the flung target stops moving, and the struck creature and the flung target each take half of the bludgeoning damage that would be dealt by the fling. A creature in the path of the flung target can choose to fail this save if it wishes.

reaction.name: Duck and Weave (Separated Tendrils Only)
entries: The khanivore gains +5 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the khanivore must see the source of the attack.

trait.name: Watery Lurker
entries: The crocodile has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while submerged in water.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

action.name: Death Roll
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target it has {@condition grappled}. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The buffalo deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Stubborn
entries: When the buffalo fails a Constitution saving throw that deals damage, it takes only half damage. On a success, it takes no damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the buffalo moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the buffalo can make one gore attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The styxosaurus can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The styxosaurus deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) and {@condition restrained}. The styxosaurus has advantage on any bite attack against a creature it is grappling.

action.name: Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The styxosaurus creates a wave of water that crashes forward in a line that is 40 feet long and 20 feet wide, originating from any point within a large body of water that the styxosaurus is in. Each creature in the area when the wave crashes down must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.
Wave, bite, sink, and chew... the Styxosaur ate all me crew.

Ancient, gargantuan, and the last of its kind, the styxosaurus stalks the various lakes and pools of Argoloth. Though hard to miss when walloping its way between lakes, this beast is a stealthy predator that strikes from the water. Tales have spread far and wide of the "Beast of Lo'kness," drawing big game hunters from across the continent. None have, as yet, been successful.

{@bold Lakeside Ambusher.} The lakes of Argoloth are not big enough to keep to keep this beast fed; it must also hunt the larger beasts who satiate their thirst at the lake's edge. It waits, motionless, on the lake's bed, feeling for vibrations on the shoreline. With a whip of its tail, it generates a huge wave which can floor even the might tyrannosaurus, before snatching the prone creature in its ferocious maw and dragging it deep into the depths to be devoured.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The zorbo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Natural Armor
entries: The zorbo magically absorbs the natural strength of its surroundings, adjusting its Armor Class based on the material it is standing or climbing on: AC 15 for wood or bone, AC 17 for earth or stone, or AC 19 for metal. If the zorbo isn't in contact with any of these substances, its AC is 10.

action.name: Destructive Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature wearing armor, carrying a shield, or in possession of a magic item that improves its AC, it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, one such item worn or carried by the creature (the target's choice) magically deteriorates, taking a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers, and the zorbo gains a +1 bonus to AC until the start of its next turn. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield or magic item that drops to a 0 AC increase is destroyed.

A zorbo (pronounced ZOR-boh) is a ferocious omnivore similar in size and appearance to a koala. Living in trees and caves, it has long claws, a dour disposition, and a fondness for humanoid flesh. A zorbo alters its natural armor to match its surroundings, and it can weaken and destroy armor, shields, and protective magic items with its sharp claws.

monster.name: Komodo Dragon
languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The komodo dragon attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.
